project.description:
CSS: each CSS statement consists of a location, a property on that location and a style to apply to that property.
CSS statements are called rules.
Rules can be combined using comma:
h1, h2 { color: gray; }
Rules can appear multiple times for the same location.
The location is called the selector
The elements within a block element for which a style is defined inherit the styles. For example, elements defined within p inherit the CSS rules defined for p. If you move it further up to the body, then all elements will be affected.
Inheritance can be overridden by specifying a different rule for a given element.
The browser knows which rule to apply by using 'the most specific' rule. If there is a rule for body and a more specific rule for p, the rule for p will be applied.
The project leverages on 007-lounge-html5 to include links to a CSS file named lounge.css.
This CSS contains very basic styles (font family, colors, horizontal lines, etc.)
No classes are used.
